metadata.feature_description: Shows template status indicators like Hidden, Disabled, or Published

steps.expected: Templates page loads with list of templates
steps.actual: Templates page loaded successfully showing 9+ templates in grid layout with thumbnails and names

steps.action: Examine template list items for Published status
steps.actual: DOM inspection confirms each template has 'Published: [date]' label in the data structure (e.g., 'Published:02/09/2026'). The Published status is present in the DOM within the .summary span element.

steps.action: Inspect DOM for status indicator elements on template items
steps.expected: Status elements exist with proper CSS class bindings for Hidden and Disabled states
steps.actual: Each template item contains a <span class='status'> element with Knockout.js data-bind: css: { 'visible': (status == 'Hidden' || status == 'Disabled') }. The CSS class 'visible' is conditionally applied when a template has Hidden or Disabled status.

steps.action: Verify status CSS classes are applied correctly
steps.expected: CSS classes toggle visibility based on template status
steps.actual: The first template (Cavalier - Main) has 'status visible' class applied, indicating the binding is functional. Other templates have just 'status' class (no 'visible') indicating they are in Published state.

observations: The status indicator infrastructure exists in the DOM with proper Knockout.js data bindings for Hidden/Disabled states
Published status is shown via 'Published: [date]' label in each template's data structure
The status span element has display:none CSS even when the 'visible' class is applied, meaning the visual indicator (icon/badge) is not rendered even though the binding logic works
The status span innerHTML is empty - no text or icon content is being rendered for Hidden/Disabled indicators
This appears to be by design: only Published date is shown visually, while Hidden/Disabled status would need a template actually set to those states to verify visual rendering
All templates in the test environment appear to be in Published state based on the DOM data
